title: Skilled — Designated Area Sponsored visa (subclass 496)
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== ​This visa is closed to new applications. Skilled — Designated Area Sponsored visa (subclass 496) Page Content ​The Skilled Designated Area Sponsored visa (subclass 496) closed to new applications on 1 September 2007. You might be able to get the Skilled — Regional (Provisional) visa (subclass 489) Members of your family unit might be able to get the Skilled — Regional (Provisional) visa (subclass 489) if you already hold this visa and they want to join you in Australia Visa applicants Details ​If information needs to be updated, contact the Adelaide General Skilled Migration (GSM) processing centre .​​ Visa holders Details You can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) for free to check your visa details and entitlements. How long your visa lasts Details This visa is valid for four years after you first enter Australia. What this visa lets you do Details This visa allows you and your dependent family members who also hold a subclass 496 visa to: live, work and study in Australia become eligible to apply for permanent residence travel to and from Australia any number of times as long as the visa is valid. You cannot access Medicare, family assistance or social security benefits. Your obligations Details You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws. Tell us if things change Details Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include: changes to your phone number, email, address or passport changes to your relationship status the birth of a child. See how to let us know if there is a change in your situation If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane.

​This visa is closed to new applications.

# Skilled — Designated Area Sponsored visa (subclass 496)

Skilled — Designated Area Sponsored visa (subclass 496)
Page Content

​The Skilled Designated Area Sponsored visa (subclass 496) closed to new applications on 1 September 2007. You might be able to get theSkilled — Regional (Provisional) visa (subclass 489).

​The Skilled Designated Area Sponsored visa (subclass 496) closed to new applications on 1 September 2007. You might be able to get the
Skilled — Regional (Provisional) visa (subclass 489)
.

Members of your family unit might be able to get theSkilled — Regional (Provisional) visa (subclass 489)if you already hold this visa and they want to join you in Australia

Members of your family unit might be able to get the
Skilled — Regional (Provisional) visa (subclass 489)
if you already hold this visa and they want to join you in Australia

## Visa applicants

Visa applicants
Details

​If information needs to be updated, contact theAdelaide General Skilled Migration (GSM) processing centre.​​

​If information needs to be updated, contact the
Adelaide General Skilled Migration (GSM) processing centre
.​​

## Visa holders

Visa holders
Details

You can useVisa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

You can use
Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)
for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

### How long your visa lasts

How long your visa lasts
Details

This visa is valid for four years after you first enter Australia.

This visa is valid for four years after you first enter Australia.

### What this visa lets you do

What this visa lets you do
Details

This visa allows you and your dependent family members who also hold a subclass 496 visa to:

This visa allows you and your dependent family members who also hold a subclass 496 visa to:
- live, work and study in Australia
live, work and study in Australia
- become eligible to apply for permanent residence
become eligible to apply for permanent residence
- travel to and from Australia any number of times as long as the visa is valid.
travel to and from Australia any number of times as long as the visa is valid.

You cannot access Medicare, family assistance or social security benefits.

You cannot access Medicare, family assistance or social security benefits.

### Your obligations

Your obligations
Details

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

### Tell us if things change

Tell us if things change
Details

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:
- changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
- changes to your relationship status
changes to your relationship status
- the birth of a child.
the birth of a child.

See how to let us know if there is achange in your situation.

See how to let us know if there is a
change in your situation
.

If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane.

If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane.
